content.user_title: Set up Tailwind CSS v4 in Expo
content.value_statement: Expo developers struggle to configure Tailwind CSS v4 for cross-platform styling. This skill provides complete setup instructions for react-native-css and NativeWind v5, enabling universal styling across iOS, Android, and web.
actual_capabilities: Configure Metro bundler with NativeWind v5 transformer
Set up PostCSS config for Tailwind CSS v4
Implement platform-specific styling with media queries
Define custom theme variables in CSS
Use CSS variables for dynamic styling in components
limitations: Does not execute any code or modify files automatically
Requires manual configuration following the provided steps
Does not cover Tailwind v3 or NativeWind v4 setup
Does not provide troubleshooting for runtime errors

6. Create CSS-wrapped components using useCssElement hook

output_examples.input: How do I use CSS variables in my components?
output: Import the useCSSVariable hook from your tw components:

best_practices: Set inlineVariables: false in Metro config to avoid breaking PlatformColor in CSS variables
Use platform media queries (@media ios/android) for platform-specific font and color handling
Wrap React Native components with useCssElement to enable className support
anti_patterns: Do not create babel.config.js with NativeWind presets for Tailwind v4 - configuration is CSS-first now
Do not use autoprefixer - lightningcss in Expo handles vendor prefixes automatically
Do not skip creating CSS-wrapped components - className will not work without useCssElement

faq.question: What versions of Expo and React Native are supported?
faq.answer: This setup works with Expo SDK 52+ and React Native 0.76+. The skill uses NativeWind v5 which requires the new Metro transformer architecture.

faq.question: Do I need to configure tailwind.config.js?
faq.answer: No. Tailwind v4 uses CSS-first configuration. Define your theme variables directly in global.css using @theme blocks instead of tailwind.config.js.

faq.question: How do I handle different fonts on iOS and Android?
faq.answer: Use CSS @media queries to define platform-specific font variables. iOS uses system fonts while Android uses normal fallback fonts.

faq.question: Can I use Tailwind utility classes directly on components?
faq.answer: No. You must use CSS-wrapped components (View, Text, Pressable) that use the useCssElement hook. Standard React Native components do not support className.

faq.question: How do I debug styles not applying?
faq.answer: Check three things: global.css is imported in your app entry, components are wrapped with useCssElement, and Metro config has withNativewind applied.

faq.question: What is the difference between react-native-css and NativeWind?
faq.answer: react-native-css provides the CSS runtime parser, while NativeWind v5 provides the Metro transformer that enables Tailwind processing in the build pipeline.
